text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Amiga 4000 is Commodore's last high-end computer in the Amiga family, released in 1992. Commodore itself would soon file for bankruptcy in 1994. Supported up until 1996, the 4000 used the Motorola 68060 processor with a base RAM of 512MB, a PowerPC 604e card and a RTG display for 24-bit "True Color" in addition to the AGA chipset. The base model also included a CD-ROM drive and IDE hard-disks. Software would be developed for the 4000 up to as late as 2002.
